com.example.currencyrates

Class CurrenciesListAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • android.widget.ArrayAdapter<CurrencyModel>
        • com.example.currencyrates.CurrenciesListAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.Filterable, android.widget.ListAdapter, android.widget.SpinnerAdapter, android.widget.ThemedSpinnerAdapter

    class CurrenciesListAdapter
extends android.widget.ArrayAdapter<CurrencyModel>
    The list adapter based on the ArrayAdapter, which is used for the ListView. This class also contains the CurrencyModel, which will be used to hold the list item data, and the CurrenciesListAdapter.ListItem view holder class, which contains each list item view instances in order ButterKnife to maintain better the memory allocation.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Nikola Georgiev

      • getView

        @NonNull
public android.view.View getView(int position,
                                          @Nullable
                                          android.view.View convertView,
                                          @NonNull
                                          android.view.ViewGroup parent)
        A Callback, that will be called every time the ListView needs to get the list item View at specific list position. Implemented logic to create CurrenciesListAdapter.ListItem view if not present at the specified position. An instance to the item CurrenciesListAdapter.ListItem will be added to the view tag (see View.getTag()).
        Specified by:
        getView in interface android.widget.Adapter
        Overrides:
        getView in class android.widget.ArrayAdapter<CurrencyModel>
        Parameters:
        position - int - The position of the required view in the list.
        convertView - View - An instance of the view, if already created.
        parent - ViewGroup - The parent view or view group, if any.
        Returns:
        View - The view at the specified list position.

        Parameters:
        v - The view that was clicked.
        actionId - Identifier of the action. This will be either the identifier you supplied, or EditorInfo.IME_NULL if being called due to the enter key being pressed.
